Activate/deactivate a menu item

Source: R/activate.R
activate.Rd

Activates a menu item with the same syntax as dplyr::pull(). Activating a menu item allows you to perform operations on the active item. activate() turns a navigatr_menu object into an navigatr_item object, and deactivate() turns it back.

Usage

activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)

# S3 method for navigatr_menu
activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)

# S3 method for navigatr_item
activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)

deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)

# S3 method for navigatr_menu
deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)

# S3 method for navigatr_item
deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)

Arguments

.data

A navigatr_menu object.

...

In activate(), one or more variables passed to dplyr::pull(). In deactivate(), unused (for extensibility).

.add

Whether to add new variables to the path indices. If FALSE (default value), the menu will be deactivated first by deactivate().

x

A navigatr_menu object.

deep

If TRUE (default value), deactivate recursively.

Value

In activate(), An navigatr_item object. If it inherits from class navigatr_menu, the menu will be displayed hierarchically. Otherwise, the active data will be displayed. In deactivate(), A navigatr_menu object.

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

mn1 <- new_menu(key = c("band_members", "band_instruments"),
                value = list(band_members, band_instruments))

mn1 %>%
  activate(band_members) %>%
  filter(band == "Beatles")
#> # [x] band_members:     tibble [2 x 2]
#> # [ ] band_instruments: tibble [3 x 2]
#> # 
#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>   name  band   
#>   <chr> <chr>  
#> 1 John  Beatles
#> 2 Paul  Beatles

# Items can also be specified as integers
mn1 %>%
  activate(2)
#> # [ ] band_members:     tibble [3 x 2]
#> # [x] band_instruments: tibble [3 x 2]
#> # 
#> # A tibble: 3 x 2
#>   name  plays 
#> * <chr> <chr> 
#> 1 John  guitar
#> 2 Paul  bass  
#> 3 Keith guitar

mn1 %>%
  activate(-1) %>%
  deactivate()
#> # [ ] band_members:     tibble [3 x 2]
#> # [ ] band_instruments: tibble [3 x 2]
#> # 
#> # Please `activate()` an item.

# To activate items in a nested menu, specify multiple variables
mn2 <- new_menu(key = c("key1", "key2"),
                value = list(mn1, mn1))
mn2 %>%
  activate(key1, band_members)
#> # [x] key1: menu [2 x 3]
#> #   [x] band_members:     tibble [3 x 2]
#> #   [ ] band_instruments: tibble [3 x 2]
#> # [ ] key2: menu [2 x 3]
#> # 
#> # A tibble: 3 x 2
#>   name  band   
#> * <chr> <chr>  
#> 1 Mick  Stones 
#> 2 John  Beatles
#> 3 Paul  Beatles
